H0.text: Were there mountains in Louisiana 30 million years ago? The 30‑million‑year‑old tropical plant fossil that Anne and her father found in Louisiana helps them answer this question.

H1.text: What was the climate like in Louisiana 30 million years ago is the question that Anne and her father answer with the 30‑million‑year‑old tropical plant fossil they find in Louisiana.

H2.text: "Were there earthquakes in Louisiana 30 million years ago? is the question that the 30‑million‑year‑old tropical plant fossil found by Anne and her father in Louisiana helps them answer."

H3.text: What kind of animals lived in Louisiana 30 million years ago is the question Anne and her father can answer by studying the 30-million‑year‑old tropical plant fossil they find in Louisiana.

A4.text: Knowing which plants were present leads to an understanding of precipitation and temperature

A5.text: Sediments, sometimes lithified to form rock, may contain remnants of preserved vegetation, animals, plankton, or pollen, which may be characteristic of certain climatic zones
